name: places/ChIJ7WaoOORYwokRPlAjzlmUpTY
formattedAddress: 227 E 56th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 227 E 56th St, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text:
Great price for nyc last remaining gay sauna.

I've noticed too many negative comments.

If you travel around the world and visit other Saunas, you'd know that the price is similar in comparison.

Get a yearly membership. It's $40
Or stay DL or closeted and each time you go, you'd have to pay for the temporary membership fee at $15 for five visits.

Remember to put your ego aside. Everyone is sexy to someone. If it doesn't match, don't take it out on others, or yourself.

I give this place 3 stars for layout and set up. Others in the USA are better equipped, with hot tubs, pools etc.

Yes the staff ask for tips. Remember it's like housekeeping. They clean up your mess.

I donâ€™t believe these reviews. I almost didnâ€™t go to this spot because of them and it was a great experience. I went on a Saturday afternoon around 12 and it was pretty quiet. Crowd came
around 4pm and really picked up from then on. Entry fee was $44.  Staff was very polite. Place is very clean and enjoyed chatting with several people there.

originalText.text: I was there on 01/19/2024 and it was awesome! I love their staff, they were very handsome and open to have some fun. All the people there was very friendly and respectful. I'm definitely going back on February.

originalText.text: Itâ€™s kind of weird that itâ€™s next to a high school.  The front desk staff were friendly and efficient.  However, $85 for 4 hours is crazy compared Steamworks Chicago, Mega-Plex Providence, and Club Aqua Miami; all which give you 8+ hours.  The rooms are the smallest closest Iâ€™ve ever been in.  The crowd is 50+. There were 4 people under 30. My friend and I were 2 of the 4. The place is fairly clean!!  They have private bathrooms which is a plus. Overall I wouldnâ€™t spend money here again unless they have a special going on.
